titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, International Division, Middle East and Africa, Office Files of Lowell Hardin
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, International Division, Middle East and Africa, Office Files of Lowell Hardin FA1528

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-12 16:45:03 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, International Division, Middle East and Africa, Office Files of Lowell Hardin

physdesc.extent: 18 boxes (16 letter document containers and 2 legal document containers)

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to RAC in 2019 by the Ford Foundation and ingested by RAC as Accessions 2019:046 and 2019:053.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 1: International Agriculture Research and Training
Subseries 1: Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research (CGIAR) and International Agricultural Research Centers, 1968-1980
Subseries 2: Arid Lands Agricultural Development Program (ALAD), 1971-1975
Subseries 3: Program Strategy Records and Information Papers on Agricultural Programs, 1968-1982

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at https://rockarch.org/collections/access-and-request-materials/#citations

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with "fair use". If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection, or items within a collection, it is the users responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Standard processing by Katie Martin, June 2019

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lowell Stewart Hardin earned a bachelor's degree in agricultural economics from Purdue University in 1939 and his doctorate from Cornell University in 1943. He was a member of the Purdue agricultural economics department faculty from 1943 to 1965 and served as department head from 1953 to 1965.

In 1965, Hardin left Purdue to join the Ford Foundation as a program officer within the Latin American Office setting up agricultural training programs. Hardin and his colleagues at the Ford and Rockefeller Foundations worked to create international agriculture research stations, first in the Philippines, then in Mexico. Ultimately, there were seventeen centers around the world in a global network covering the major food commodities. International staffs under international boards of directors were supported to do research and training, primarily in sustainable methods for plant and animal production to increase the available food supply.

In 1970, Hardin became a program officer with the Office of the Vice President within the Ford Foundation's International Division, Middle East and Africa program. During his 17 years with the Foundation, he was a principal architect of the worldwide system of international agricultural research centers.
Hardin returned to Purdue in 1981, and he became the Assistant Director of International Programs in Agriculture, a position he held until 2007. Hardin died in 2015 at the age of 97.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lowell Hardin worked for the Ford Foundation from 1965-1981 in the field of international agriculture research and training. This collection of Hardin's office files contains reports related to agricultural training and production, budget and program planning documents from agricultural research and training centers, planning documents and reports from the Arid Lands Agricultural Development (ALAD) Program in Beirut, and meeting materials from the Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research (CGIAR).

Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research (CGIAR) and International Agricultural Research Centers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: CGIAR Technical Advisory Committee (TAC) meeting materials, international agricultural centers' budget and program materials, and reports

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Consultative Group for International Agricultural Research (CGIAR) was established on May 19, 1971, to coordinate international agricultural research efforts and achieve food security in developing countries. CGIAR arose in response to the widespread concern in the mid-20th century that rapid increases in human populations would soon lead to widespread famine. Originally, CGIAR supported four international research centers: the International Rice Research Institute (IRRI) (est. 1960), the International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center (CIMMYT) (est. 1963), the International Center for Tropical Agriculture (CIAT)(est. 1962), and the International Institute of Tropical Agriculture (IITA) (est. 1967).

Arid Lands Agricultural Development Program (ALAD)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Arid Land Agricultural Development (ALAD) was a program of the Ford Foundation that operated in Lebanon in the 1960s and 1970s. The program's goals were to make the best use of limited water resources, to improve production of staple food crops in a region of major food gaps, and to address the complex integration of crop and livestock production in the dry areas. ALAD later became the International Center for Agricultural Research in the Dry Areas (ICARDA), established in 1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Primarily reports and program planning materials
